page.title: 01THE LOCATION
page.content: {LANDSCAPE.} -The area covered is very rural with virtually no industry. There are no large towns and only one village of any size; FULFORD, which has the primary school working with us on this Project. The area does not include our school, but does include a large part of our catchment area and although Fulford is not included, a few children do attend ALLEYNES. {LOCAL HISTORY.}-ALLEYNES School was founded in 1558 in Stone and although the major town in the area it was not mentioned in the original DOMESDAY. There are however a number of villages within a Five mile radius which were included and still exist today such as Fulford, Cotwalton and Moddershall. References to these were made in an English translation of Domesday by Dr.H.Malcolm Fraser, Headmaster of ALLEYNES GRAMMAR SCHOOL -1916 to 1936.
